intro: Ceropegia thuretii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and succulent stems. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate watering to prevent root rot. Ceropegia thuretii is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
